solution_line_template: Peter needs {feedings_per_day} * {oats_per_feeding} pounds of oats = <<{feedings_per_day}*{oats_per_feeding}={oats_per_horse_per_day}>>{oats_per_horse_per_day} pounds of oats per horse per day.
Peter will need {oats_per_horse_per_day} pounds oats * {num_days} days = <<{oats_per_horse_per_day}*{num_days}={total_oats_per_horse}>>{total_oats_per_horse} pounds of oats per horse.
Peter will need {total_oats_per_horse} pounds of oats * {num_horses} horses = <<{total_oats_per_horse}*{num_horses}={total_oats_all_horses}>>{total_oats_all_horses} pounds of oats total.
Peter needs {grain_per_feeding} pounds of grain * {num_days} days per horse = <<{grain_per_feeding}*{num_days}={total_grain_per_horse}>>{total_grain_per_horse} pounds of grain per horse.
Peter will need {total_grain_per_horse} pounds of grain * {num_horses} horses = <<{total_grain_per_horse}*{num_horses}={total_grain_all_horses}>>{total_grain_all_horses} pounds of grain total.

For {num_days} days Peter will need a total of {total_oats_all_horses} pounds oats + {total_grain_all_horses} pounds grain = <<{total_oats_all_horses}+{total_grain_all_horses}={total_food_needed}>>{total_food_needed} pounds total.
